title:
Limit theorems for the number of crossings and stress in projections of
  the random geometric graph
authors: Hanna D\"oring and Lianne de Jonge
abstract:
We consider the number of edge crossings in a random graph drawing generated
by projecting a random geometric graph on some compact convex set $W\subset
\mathbb{R}^d$, $d\geq 3$, onto a plane. The positions of these crossings form
the support of a point process. We show that if the expected number of
crossings converges to a positive but finite value, this point process
converges to a Poisson point process in the Kantorovich-Rubinstein distance. We
further show a multivariate central limit theorem between the number of
crossings and a second variable called the stress that holds when the expected
vertex degree in the random geometric graph converges to a positive finite
value.
